comment.author: 26257394@N08
comment._content: Wow, this is a great capture.  I take it this is the location where the stone arch bridge is now?

comment.realname: Keene Public Library and the Historical Society of Cheshire County
comment.author: 25960495@N06
comment._content: Yes, it is the same location, but the present highway bridge is concrete and not stone. The railroad bridge, whose roof you can see jutting up on the right of this photo, and its center pier which is behind the front right pier, is just upriver and is stone.
comment.authorname: Keene and Cheshire County (NH) Historical Photos

comment.author: 26257394@N08
comment._content: Keene and Cheshire County (NH) Historical Photos Thanks for the reply. I was there last December and I'm planning to move to Vermont when I finish school next year. Bellows Falls is a beautiful little town.
